org.schwering.evi.conf
Class Properties

java.lang.Object
  java.util.Dictionary
      java.util.Hashtable
          java.util.Properties
              org.schwering.evi.conf.Properties
All Implemented Interfaces:
java.lang.Cloneable, java.util.Map, java.io.Serializable
public class Properties
extends java.util.Properties

Extended java.util.Properties class. Offers a number of methods to store and load commonly used objects.

Version:
$Id$
Author:
Christoph Schwering (schwering@gmail.com)
See Also:
Serialized Form

Constructor Detail

Properties

public Properties(java.lang.String moduleId)
           throws java.io.IOException
Initializes a new properties file at CONFIG_DIR/moduleId.

This is a shorthand for Properties(moduleId, true).

Parameters:
moduleId - The module's id, used as filename for the config file.
See Also:
MainConfiguration.CONFIG_DIR

Properties

public Properties(java.lang.String moduleId,
                  boolean create)
           throws java.io.IOException
Initializes a new properties file at CONFIG_DIR/moduleId.
The file is not loaded!
Example: Your home directory is /home/chs (Unix example), then the CONFIG_DIR is /home/chs/.evi/. Say your module's id is org.schwering.evi.modules.irc.IRC, then the file will be /home/chs/.evi/org.schwering.evi.modules.irc.IRC.

Note: You don't need to pass the module id as parameter. You can also pass anything else as long it is a valid filename. However, the module id makes sense because it's unique. Thus, passing the module id avoids conflicts with other module's config files.

Parameters:
moduleId - The module's id, used as filename for the config file.
create - Indicates whether it is tried to create the file it does not yet exist.
See Also:
MainConfiguration.CONFIG_DIR
Method Detail

setShutdownHook

public void setShutdownHook(boolean set)
Enables/disables automatic store() via shutdownhook.

Parameters:
set - true adds the shutdownhook, false removes it.

          throws java.io.IOException

public java.lang.String getString(java.lang.String key)
Grabs a String out of the configuration.
Default value is "".

Parameters:

The String.

getString

public java.lang.String getString(java.lang.String key,
                                  java.lang.String def)
Grabs a String out of the configuration.
If the requested value does not exist, a new property with the key and the default value is set.

Parameters:
key - The key.
def - The default value.
Returns:
The String.

setLocale

                      java.util.Locale value)
